original: Holmström, Nils Bertil Konstantin, musiklärare, Varberg, f. 12/6/12 i Var-berg av Nikolaus H. o. Bernhardina Tohansson. G. 37 m. Ann-Mari Lindblom. Barn: Birgit f. 39. — Stud. piano f. Fritiof Kjellberg i Sthlm, musikteori f. Hilding Rosenberg. Priv. musiklär :verks. sed. 32. Dirig. f. Var-bergs ork :sällsk. sed. 37, f. Varb. kvartettsällsk. sed. 36, förste förb :’di-rig. i Hall. sångarförb. sed. 40, ledare f. Varb. kyrkokör 39-45. Medl. av Odd Fellov^, Svarta Örnisorden. Kom’p. kantat, samt styck. f. kör o. ork. Mu-sikairt. i ortspiresis^en.
translated: Holmström, Nils Bertil Konstantin, music teacher, Varberg, born on June 12, 1912 in Varberg, to Nikolaus H. and Bernhardina Tohansson. Married in 1937 to Ann-Mari Lindblom. They have a daughter named Birgit, born in 1939. Holmström studied piano with Fritiof Kjellberg in Stockholm and music theory with Hilding Rosenberg. He has been working as a private music teacher since 1932. He has been the conductor for the Varberg Orchestra Society since 1937, the Varberg Quartet Society since 1936, the first conductor for the Halland Singers' Association since 1940, and the leader of the Varberg church choir from 1939 to 1945. He is a member of the Independent Order of Odd Fellows and the Order of the Black Eagle. He has composed a cantata and pieces for choir and orchestra, and his music has been performed in the local parish.
